content.webTitle: Francesca Martin on the Beacon arts project in Mablethorpe, Lincolnshire

fields.headline: Wanted: expert toast scrapers
fields.bodyText: Do you have a way with spoons, make music with toast or do a mean impression of the lesser-spotted woodpecker? If so, get along to the Beacon arts project in Mablethorpe, Lincolnshire, this weekend, for a competition inviting local people to show off their talents - including facial spoon hanging, bird impressions, musical toast-scraping and ukulele-playing. The three-day festival celebrating performance art will also feature a recreation in the town's library of Bruce Nauman's 1968 work, Walk with Contrapposto, and a threesided football match played on a hexagonal pitch . "It's a great chance to prove that contemporary art shown in a rural context doesn't have to involve carved benches," says John Plowman, the festival's co-founder. · Email your arts stories to arts.diary@theguardian.com
